Detailed Description

This class has the ability to compress a texture to any given D3DFORMAT.

This class is typically used with limited scope.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TextureCompressor::TextureCompressor ( DX::Texture *  src,
D3DFORMAT  fmt = D3DFMT_DXT5,
uint32  numRequestedMipLevels = 0 
)

This creates a texture compressor given a source texture to compress.

Caller may optionally provide compression settings.

Parameters:
src The source texture to convert.
fmt The required destination format (optional, defaults to DXT5).
numRequestedMipLevels The number of MIP levels to convert (optional, defaults to zero).

TextureCompressor::~TextureCompressor (  ) 

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

bool TextureCompressor::convertTo ( ComObjectWrap< DX::Texture > &  destTexture  ) 

This method converts source texture to destination texture.

If texture is created, it is done so in managed pool. If conversion is unsuccessful (due to an internal DirectX issue) then destTexture is not modified.

Parameters:
destTexture Empty texture or a texture to reuse.
Returns:
true if conversion was successful, false otherwise.

void TextureCompressor::destinationFormat ( D3DFORMAT   ) 

This method sets the desired texture format.

const D3DFORMAT TextureCompressor::destinationFormat (  )  const

This method returns the desired texture format.

void TextureCompressor::pSrcTexture ( DX::Texture *   ) 

This method returns the source texture.

const DX::Texture * TextureCompressor::pSrcTexture (  )  const

This method returns the source texture.

bool TextureCompressor::save ( const std::string &  filename  ) 

This method converts the given source texture into the given texture format, and saves it to the given relative filename.

Parameters:
filename a resource tree relative filename.
Returns:
True if there were no problems.

bool TextureCompressor::stow ( DataSectionPtr  pSection,
const std::string &  childTag = "" 
)

This method converts the given source texture into the given texture format, and stows it in the given data section.

This method does not save the data section to disk.

Parameters:
pSection a Data Section smart pointer.
childTag tag within the given section.
Returns:
True if there were no problems.
